Package Client

Class Client

  • java.lang.Object
    • Client.Client
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    public class Client
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Client is class working directly with player and server. Receive and handler request from player and message from server to display for player. One play is a client object

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        public boolean connect​(java.net.InetAddress address,
                       int port)
        Attempts to connect to a server at the given address and port.
        Parameters:
        address - The address of the server to connect to.
        port - The port on the server to connect to.
        Returns:
        True if the connection was successful, false otherwise.

      • run

        public void run()
        Receive for incoming messages from the server as long as the connection to the server is active. This method creates a new thread for each incoming message to be handled by the `Listener` class.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • close

        public void close()
        This method sets the `running` false to stop the listening loop in the `run` method. Closes the connection to the server, including the socket and the print writer.

      • setState

        public void setState​(Protocol.ClientState state)
        Sets the current state of the client.
        Parameters:
        state - The new state of the client.

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage​(java.lang.String mess)
        Sends a message to the server.
        Parameters:
        mess - The message to be sent.

      • sendCommand

        public void sendCommand​(java.lang.String command,
                        java.lang.String descripton)
        Sends a command to the server with a description.
        Parameters:
        command - The command to be sent.
        descripton - The description of the command.

      • sendCommand

        public void sendCommand​(java.lang.String command)
        Sends a command to the server.
        Parameters:
        command - The command to be sent.

      • handleHello

        public void handleHello()
        Handles the "HELLO" message from the server. Requests the login if the client is in the HELLO_AWAITING state.

      • requestLogin

        public void requestLogin()
        Get username from player and send a request login with this username to server Afterward,setting the state of player to "LOGIN_AWAITING".

      • handleLogin

        public void handleLogin()
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Handles the successful login of a client by printing a success message with the username and setting the client's state to "DECISION". Then it invokes the handleUserchoice method.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs when the client is communicating with the server.

      • handleAreadyLoggedIn

        public void handleAreadyLoggedIn​(java.lang.String input)
        Handles the situation where a client tries to log in with an already used username. Prints a message asking the client to enter another username and invokes the requestLogin method.
        Parameters:
        input - the input string sent by the client that triggered this method.

      • handleList

        public void handleList​(java.lang.String input)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Handles the list of online players by splitting the input string using the character "~" separator, Printing the list of players, and then invoking the handleUserchoice method.
        Parameters:
        input - the input string sent by the client that triggered this method.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs when the client is communicating with the server.

      • handleNewGame

        public void handleNewGame​(java.lang.String input)
        Handles the start of a new game by parsing the input string, checking the client's state, and creating a new Othello game with two HumanPlayer instances. Then it prints the name of the opponent and starts the game by either making a move or waiting for the other player's turn.
        Parameters:
        input - the input string sent by the client that triggered this method.

      • makeMove

        public void makeMove()
        Makes a move in the current game if it's the client's turn and there are valid moves available. The move is determined by the player's determineMove method and sent to the server using the sendCommand method. If there are no valid moves, the method sends a MOVE command with the value "64" to the server.

      • handleMove

        public void handleMove​(java.lang.String a)
        Handles move which is sent from server by checking the client state first after parsing from string to row and col, do this move and display the board game again. Then check the next turn to decide making a move or waiting for the other player's turn.
        Parameters:
        a - the input string is sent from server to client.

      • handleGameover

        public void handleGameover​(java.lang.String input)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Handles game over which is sent from server by checking the reason of game over first
        Parameters:
        input - message from server is split by listener
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs when the client is communicating with the server.

      • handleQuit

        public void handleQuit()
        Disconnect to server and close the socket because player want to log out of game .

      • handleError

        public void handleError​(java.lang.String input)
        Handles errors encountered during the game.
        Parameters:
        input - The input that caused the error.

      • setupPlayer

        public void setupPlayer()
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Ask player what role they want to be ( Smart AI/ Native AI/ Human Player). Set player as your request.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if I/O occurs during reading process from input .

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Connect player to server by enter address and number of port
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if I/O occurs when reading data from command
